oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Multi-machine single-inverter induction motor drives are attractive in situations in which all machines are of similar ratings and operate at approximately the same load torques. The advantages include their small size compared to multi-machine multi-inverter systems, lower weight, and overall cost. This article presents a consolidated study and comparison of vector control methods applied to multi-machine drives along with relevant simulation and experimental results. The mean control method and its modifications prove to be superior to the other control approaches.
